Privacy Policy

Our Apps

(All of them, including those for iOS, Mac, Android, and at https://dicekeys.app)

Given all the effort we put into our open-source DiceKeys app (available iOS, Mac, Android, and at https://dicekeys.app) you might think that we would be getting regular updates from it.

We don't.

It never calls.

It never writes.

We hear nothing.

Our friends brag about their apps being installed into profitable medical practices or sending back detailed reports from prestigious law schools. They ask, if our app is so great, how come we never hear from it?

We have no comeback. Nothing!

You might think the web-based app could at least send us a cookie, maybe just over the holidays? But no, even that's too much to ask! We just send it the code we toiled over for years and we never hear from it again.

If the app crashes, Google or Apple may send us a report to tell us where it happened. What an awful way for us to keep track of an app we worked so hard to bring into this world.

Perhaps you and the app could send the occasional virtual postcard?

This website

We do not collect any data from this website unless you fill out a support form, in which case we may contract out to a third party (currently ZohoDesk) to provide a support form which may collect data. If you don't want to use that support form, you can mail us at support@dicekeys.com.
